results.title: GeForce RTX 5090 turns one, now costs nearly twice the MSRP - VideoCardz.com
results.content:
At retail, pricing has drifted far from anything official. The lowest in-stock listing we could find was the MSI RTX 5090 Liquid at $3,699, sold by Newegg. Other stores either show no stock at all or list placeholder prices that do not reflect real availability. This has become the normal state rather than a temporary spike.

### Crypto, COVID and AI, new GPUs can’t catch a break

There is also little reason to expect a late-cycle correction. With next-generation GPUs now expected around mid-2027, the window for prices to settle is short. Demand from the AI sector has not eased, and the market is now dealing with a DRAM shortage crisis that pushes costs in the opposite direction. [...] ## RTX 5090 turns 1, but there’s nothing to celebrate

One year after launch, the GeForce RTX 5090 is still defined less by performance and more by access. The card sits at the top of the current GPU stack and remains the flagship for this generation. The card wasn’t easily available at launch, and let’s remind our readers the card was pushed back a little. While we have seen plenty of reviewers and influencers with multiple RTX 5090 cards at launch, regular buyers had to wait another few weeks for stock to normalize. But this didn’t last long. [...] 10. Moderators may edit/delete comments without notice.

results.title: The most cursed-looking graphics card I've ever seen just set a benchmarking world record - PC Gamer
results.content:
Well, far from resting on their laurels, the team has since taken their efforts one step further (via Videocardz). Thanks to the addition of an Asus GeForce RTX 2080 Ti PCB as its base and some clever power tweaking, the GPU-with-a-hole has managed to set a world record: the top spot in Unigine Superposition's online rankings for an RTX 5070 Ti, running the 8K optimized preset.

Over the course of a seven-hour+ live stream, the team fought against a litany of issues to convince the Frank-o-card to perform properly, including an early problem with low-resolution-only output and voltage drops under load.

results.title: Intel Panther Lake Core Ultra review: Intel’s best laptop CPU in a very long time - Ars Technica
results.content: It’s also around twice as fast as the Radeon 890M GPU in the Ryzen AI 9 HX 370. In Cyberpunk 2077, it’s closer to five times as fast, thanks to the game’s heavy ray-tracing effects and the AMD RDNA3 architecture’s struggle with some kinds of ray-tracing effects. The Arc B390 is still far from playable 1080p performance in Cyberpunk with RT effects on, but it will be easier to find the settings that make it playable than it would be on the AMD GPU. [...] All of that said, the B390 is an impressive performer, particularly in the Zenbook’s “performance” mode. Across both synthetic graphics benchmarks and benchmark runs in Borderlands 3, Shadow of the Tomb Raider, and Cyberpunk 2077, Panther Lake’s GPU is nearly twice as fast as Lunar Lake’s Arc 140V GPU and over twice as fast as the Arc GPU in the Core Ultra Series 1 Meteor Lake chips. [...] AMD has argued that the Panther Lake chips should be compared not to the regular Ryzen AI Max 300 and 400-series CPUs (codenamed Strix Point and Gorgon Point, and both based on essentially identical silicon) but to the larger and more powerful Ryzen AI Max+ chips and their Radeon RX 8060S and 8050S GPUs (codenamed Strix Halo).

results.title: AMD says Steam Machine is on track to ship early this year, and Xbox 2027 SoC work is progressing - VideoCardz.com
results.content:
### Next-gen consoles powered by RDNA5

Microsoft and AMD announced a multi-year partnership in June 2025. The announcement described co-engineered silicon across future consoles and cloud gaming servers. As we recall, earlier internal documents that surfaced during the FTC case had pointed to 2028 at the time. These documents mentioned RDNA5 based architecture specifically. Jan 11 [...] Leak chatter has linked the next-gen Xbox chip to Zen 6 and Zen 6c CPU cores and an RDNA 5 GPU, often under the “Magnus” label. Meanwhile, Sony has not announced PlayStation 6, but they did announce a close partnership with AMD. Some rumors suggest that Sony is exploring a standalone handheld that can play PlayStation 5 games, and that work could carry into the PlayStation 6 timeframe. Microsoft is pushing a more PC-like Xbox strategy, and the ASUS ROG Xbox Ally handhelds are the current example of that approach.
